sentence.Network_en: Rumour, myth and hearsay obscure the truth after months of bloodshed.
sentence.Network_cn: 杀戮持续了数月后，真相在谣言、谎话和传闻的遮掩下变得模糊不清。

sentence.Network_en: We can't make a decision based on hearsay and guesswork.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们不能根据传言和猜测作决定。

sentence.Network_en: You are only supposing this on hearsay, you have no proof.
sentence.Network_cn: 你只是根据传闻想像而已, 并没有证据.

entry.def: Hearsay is information which you have been told but do not know to be true.

example.ex: Much of what was reported to them was hearsay...
example.tran: 向他们汇报的消息中很多都是道听途说。

example.ex: Rumour, myth and hearsay obscure the truth after months of bloodshed.
example.tran: 杀戮持续了数月后，真相在谣言、谎话和传闻的遮掩下变得模糊不清。

means.word_mean: 1. gossip (usually a mixture of truth and untruth) passed around by word of mouth
1. heard through another rather than directly;

auth_sentence.content: Both opinions rely on hearsay, it would seem.
auth_sentence.res_content: Both opinions rely on hearsay, it would seem.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Both opinions rely on hearsay, it would seem.

auth_sentence.content: The object of legend and hearsay has come to light!
auth_sentence.res_content: The object of legend and hearsay has come to light!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The object of legend and hearsay has come to light!

auth_sentence.content: Wishful thinking and nonsense hearsay serves no one any good.
auth_sentence.res_content: Wishful thinking and nonsense hearsay serves no one any good.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Wishful thinking and nonsense hearsay serves no one any good.

sentences.en: They started to piece the story together from hearsay.
sentences.cn: 他们开始根据传闻把事情的经过一点点拼湊起来。

sentences.en: She discovered a world of parties and pleasure she had hitherto only known by hearsay.
sentences.cn: 她发现了一个以前只是略有听闻的花花世界。

sentences.en: You are only supposing this on hearsay,you have no proof.
sentences.cn: 你只是根据传闻想象而已,并没有证据。
